content.value:
President Pranab Mukherjee addressed the first session of both Houses of Parliament post the elections to the 16th Lok Sabha. IndiaSpend decided to analyse the words spoken by the President to see which “words” were spoken the  most or were referred to in his speech.  The above chart shows that the word ” government” was used the most number of times at 89 times followed by “India” at 31 times and development “17  times”. For this graph, we have excluded common English words from the list.

 

Below are the 20 key points   in President Mukherjee’s address:

 

1. Development through good governance

2. Minimum government, maximum governance

3. Government dedicated to the poor

4. To end the rural-urban divide guided by idea of Rurban

5. Har Khet ko paani; to launch Pradhan Mantri Krishi Sinchayee Yojana

6. Youth development to youth-led development; har haath ko hunar

7. To launch national sports talent search system

8. To roll out National Health Assurance Mission

9. To launch Swachh Bharat Mission

10. National Madrasa Modernisation Programme

11. Backbone of new ways of working will be a digital India

12. To promote labour-intensive manufacturing

13. Sagar Mala to connect ports through road and rail

14. To develop national energy policy

15. To build 100 cities focussed on specialized domains

16. Every family to have pucca house by 75th year of Independence

17. To launch National mission on Himalayas

18. To create 50 tourist circuits

19. To revive Brand India on strength of 5Ts: Tradition, Talent, Tourism, Trade and Technology

20. With three Ds of democracy, demography and demand on our side, India to poised to actualize aspirations
